instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Hi guys i have an 820-00840 that not boot... (stuck at 5v)

here there is the history of previous techician (i can't say if it is 100% true)

macbook dead

found a short with thermal camera on c3000

caps removed (not replaced)

tried to charge -> smoke

found u3100 burnt

changed, no luck

changed u3200 no luck

rechanged u3200 with the original one. No luck

now i have this laptop.



i have changed both usb-c chip from a IDENTICAL donor board and C3000

FINALLY 20V! BUT NO BOOT

Using Thermal camera i have u7800 super hot

[URL unfurl="true"]https://uploadnow.io/it/share?utm_medium=46288f1b-0bf1-4d76-9980-eeb33a19aa0d[/URL]


I have checked for shorts around and under u7800 with no luck



I have pp3v3 ldo 3v
I have ppbus pmic 13v
I have pp1v25_ref 1,3v

But pp5v ldo stuck at 2,7v This Line is not shorted


replaced u7800 (from donor board)

Now i have po5vldo… u7800 is not super hot anymore…(but hot together with u7100)

Now is super hot u3900 and a little bit cpu…

This is the amp meter

[URL]https://uploadnow.io/f/nJDYmsx[/URL]

Changed u3900 still the same

I have Nothing on display, no caps lock no fan spinning

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check if the redriver chip is not also burnt.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cufCRucKvdO4RLoyMMmHvDNDpP8NebtR/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Do you get 3V3_S5?

Check diode mode to ground on all big coils and other test points.
Compare with good board, or reference table.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-00840[/URL]

After all, CPU may be dead; be aware of that.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
thank you for your reply!

redriver chip seems perfect

yes i have 3v3_s5 stable

checked big coils with this awesome table chart you gave me...seems all ok

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).
First, be sure SMC_ONOFF_L stays normally high at 3V.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: [URL unfurl="true"]https://uploadnow.io/s/505893cb-288e-4126-8ed1-fd246263f019[/URL]

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Please, confirm if that drop pulse was on PM_PWRBTN_L.
STOP uploading videos; just reply the questions!

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
sorry, i was thinking that best thing was to show you the behaviour.

i confirm: the drop is on pm_pwrbtn_l

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: Then, check for pulse (0->3V) at PM_SLP_S4_L at same time.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: Yes i have the pulse

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
You should have pulse at PM_SLP_S3_L too; confirm that.
Then check for pulse at all big coils; when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.
You can use SW9988/89 pads, instead of power button; solder R9988, if not in place.

Test if machine turns on in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S3_L  goes to 3,3 as soon as i connect power suppply, then come back to 0 after some seconds then to 3,3 (stable)

r9988 is not in place...should i do a jumper with a wire? is the jumper for "bypass mode"?



ps you ask me to trigger SMC_ONOFF_L

then you said that i can use sw9988..but it is SMC_ONOFF_L _R : is it the same?

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Not the same, if R9988 is not soldered.
Mentioned pads are bigger and more easy to use; but imply soldering R9988.
However, if you feel comfortable, just use an wire soldered to SMC_ONOFF.

If PM_SLP_S3_L remains high, then you should have voltage on all big coils; maybe not on CPU coils.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S3_L and  PM_SLP_S4_L   goes to 3,3 as soon as i connect power suppply, then come back to 0 after some seconds then to 3,3

but this behavious is WITHOUT trigger SMC_ONOFF_L

if i try to short SMC_ONOFF_L nothing happen!

i have no voltage on the 3 big coils on the left of the cpu

I have u3900 and ssd super hot (47 degrees), then u5800 and u7800 hot

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Power on sequence starts when charger is connected.
I said to test triggering SMC_ONOFF_L, because you didn't mention to have voltage on any big coil; apart of 3V3_S5.

L7410/20/30 will not get voltage as normal; nor even when board boots.
What voltage do you get on L7210/20, after 10s?
If nothing, check L7370 voltage too.

BTW, when you deal with groups of 2-3 coils, good enough to check one coil only.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: No voltage in All Coil you ask me to check

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Now check L7730, L7900/60 and L8030/60.
Also check all output voltages from page 64 (Power FETs).

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
[help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Probably CPU problem then.

Just in case, try known good BIOS.
Also check all BootROM SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
can you help me with a good bios?

Where i can find bootrom spi bus termination?

why don’t you care about hot chip?

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Remove SSD when you test the board alone on the desk.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sw2QQksCx-aI3JWn7t0AUeLQr5viu-Yd/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
ok i will update you tomorrow!

the chip hot is u3900....i don't understand why! i've changed it without luck

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
U3900 is the camera controller.
Do you get correct voltage on its coils?

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
value of  BootROM SPI Bus Series Termination resistors  are all ok

how can understand where are coils of u3900?

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
[help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: 1,2 and 1,3v

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Did you also check the traces of BootROM resistors?
Tried the BIOS?

This board can boot without U3900.

ALL_SYS_PWRGD stays high?
Check U7100 voltages; pins 41, 42, 48.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
It not boot without u3900…

i will check as soon as possible other Thing thanks

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: Keep U3900 out, if you have doubts; is not needed to boot.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD  3.2 always

pin 41 13v
pin 42 0v
pin 48 3.2v

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: without u3800. i can clearly see hot u3100 u5000 u7800

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
"pin 42 0v"
Check diode mode to ground there.
If short, bad C7102, or U7100.
Anyway, R7192 is burnt/open.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
In diode mode i have 0.001mv

in ohm mode i have 2. ohm to ground

replaced r7192, but no luck, still 0v on pin 42

removing c7102, i have still 1,2ohm resistence


replaced U7100 now i have 2v on pin 42

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Replace again R7192; it got burnt because of bad U7100.
I never said to replace R7192 BEFORE finding the cause of short.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Sorry… i have not understood…

hovever now i have 2v on pin 42: is it ok?

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Do you have 5V at pin1/R7192?
If yes, same voltage must be found on pin2; is just 1 ohm resistor (if not burnt).

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: ok you was right! with another resistence now i have 5v!! on both sides of the resistence and on pin 42! and now?

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: Do you get now L7210/20 voltage?

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: 0,9v on both

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
It should drop to aprox 0.65V after 10-15s; check that.
Also check for USB activity.
If not, try known good BIOS, clean ME.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sw2QQksCx-aI3JWn7t0AUeLQr5viu-Yd/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
yes it drops to 0,65....

could i try to mount the motherboard and see if it boots??

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message: It should work then.

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
i have video and charging icon!!! 

now i resolder u3900

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
now i have two problem

no trackpad/keyboard

and no webcam:

could keyboard work without trackpad (because i've broken a little bit j4801)

what can i check about keyboard/trackpad 

and what about webcam? (i think to resolder the original u3900)

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
Check first if you get 5V at pin 46/J8500.
Resolder original U3900; be sure to get good solders.

Keyboard can't work if trackpad is bad...

threads.title: [help] FIRST POST: 820-00840 DEAD AND HOT AS HELL
threads.message:
webcam ok with original u3900!

i don't understand why, but trackpad is dead...

changed with another trackpad and all is ok...how is it possible?!??!
